Text:
Let me help my Republican colleagues understand who it is that we're going to be raising taxes for under our reconciliation bill.
✅ billionaires
✅ large corporations
❌ working families earning less than $400,000 a year https://t.co/UUHxL5ZNp9

The COVID pandemic has claimed over 653,000 American lives, and hospitals in many parts of the country are now filled to capacity — especially with those who have not been vaccinated. 

For the safety of yourself and of your loved ones, please, get vaccinated.

Every powerful special interest and their lobbyists are flooding Capitol Hill to try to defeat the most consequential legislation for working people since the Great Depression. But if we stand together, we're going to defeat them and deliver for the working class. https://t.co/e0YdjJ875i

If we do not move aggressively to combat climate change and if we allow the planet to become increasingly unlivable, we will be showing absolute contempt for our younger generation. It would be grossly immoral to turn our backs on our kids and grandchildren. We must act now.

We have a choice to make. We can listen to the climate deniers and not worry about the impact of climate change and turn our backs on our kids and grandkids.

Or we can listen to the scientists who tell us that we must act boldly and aggressively to prevent a climate catastrophe.

Now is the time to enact the most consequential legislation for the working class of this country since the days of Franklin Delano Roosevelt and the New Deal. 

Now is the time for working class solidarity. Now is the time to finally build a government which works for all of us.

Now is the time for legislation which says yes, it is absurd that the United States is the only major country not to guarantee workers some form of paid family and medical leave — we must end that absurdity and guarantee paid leave to workers.

To me, that level of inequality is morally unconscionable. 

Now is the time for legislation that says yes, in the richest country on the face of the planet, seniors must be able to age with dignity — we must expand Medicare to cover hearing aids, dental care, and eyeglasses.

Is it acceptable to you that while 2 people own more wealth than the bottom 40% in this country, half our people live paycheck to paycheck, seniors are unable to hear or to see the world around them, and new moms are guaranteed ZERO paid days to spend with their baby?

This is what oligarchy is all about. The billionaire class and large corporations are working overtime to defeat the Reconciliation Bill, the most significant legislation for working people since the New Deal. Their greed has no end. This is why we need a political revolution.

Major countries that guarantee some form of paid leave for workers: 
🇪🇪🇧🇬🇭🇺🇯🇵🇱🇹🇦🇹🇸🇰🇱🇻🇳🇴🇸🇮🇩🇪🇨🇿🇫🇮🇸🇪🇱🇺🇭🇷🇵🇱🇰🇷🇵🇹🇨🇱🇩🇰🇮🇸🇨🇦🇮🇹🇫🇷🇬🇷🇪🇸🇧🇪🇨🇷🇳🇱🇲🇹🇨🇾🇮🇱🇲🇽🇬🇧🇹🇷🇦🇺🇳🇿🇨🇭🇮🇪

Major countries that will finally guarantee paid leave for workers when we pass our Budget Reconciliation Legislation: 
🇺🇸

Thanks to the labor movement, workers have weekends, 8-hour workdays, paid overtime, a minimum wage, breaks during work, the right to strike, workplace safety standards, and child labor laws.

This #LaborDay, we must recommit to growing the union movement in this country.

Today in America: 
- the two richest people own more wealth than the bottom 40% 
- the top 1% owns more wealth than the bottom 92% 
- 45% of all new income has gone to the top 1% since 2009 

Is that the kind of economy any working person ought to be satisfied with?

The fossil fuel industry is spending millions to defeat the reconciliation bill and the provisions in it which will transform our energy system. They must not be allowed to succeed. The future of the planet is more important than their greed and profiteering.
The rich are getting much richer. They’re off buying spaceships and zooming around space. Yes, we are going to make them pay their fair share. No apologies to be made. https://t.co/poLUpaVqzv

People understand that at a time of horrific income and wealth inequality, when half our people live paycheck to paycheck, that the wealthiest people must pay their fair share of taxes, and that we should use that new revenue to improve life for middle class and working families.
How on earth can we continue to ignore the destructive forces of climate change? https://t.co/1e79AazgR3

In 2020, 1 in 10 in-person early voters in Harris County, Texas used drive-thru voting to cast their ballot — making it significantly easier to participate in our democracy.

Republicans in Texas just banned that practice. 

Unacceptable. We must pass the For The People Act.

Republicans go on and on, "Ohhh, Bernie and the Democrats are gonna raise taxes!"

You know what? Yeah. You're right. At a time when billionaires in this country don’t pay a nickel in federal income tax in a given year — we are going to raise taxes on the billionaire class.

How does this sit with you? In America today, you've got 30 laws already enacted in 18 states which restrict access to the vote. Got that? On top of that, more than 400 bills restricting voting access have been introduced in 49 states. 

Our job now: pass the For The People Act.

Here is the situation. Right-wing state legislatures in states all over the country are working overtime to roll back voting rights, to prevent people of color, the poor and working class from being able to vote, all to subvert the very notion of democracy. We must fight back.

Terrorism has been, and remains, a very serious issue. But, in fighting terrorism, we must be smart & not make a bad situation worse. According to a recent report, our 20 year war on terror has killed over 900,000 people and cost $8 trillion. That's not smart. We must do better.
I know these are troubling times. Never, ever lose your sense of outrage. But you must also never give up the hope that through struggle and through solidarity, we can win a better world.

A recent poll found over 60 percent of people making under $50,000 a year support our reconciliation bill. Why? Because whether you are a working class Republican, Democrat, or Independent, at the end of the day, you want the federal government to finally respond to your needs. https://t.co/VCv1HzZE7Z

The special interests right now are flooding Capitol Hill trying to defeat us.
The drug companies are trying to defeat us.
The fossil fuel industry is trying to defeat us.
The billionaire class is trying to defeat us.
If we stand together, and fight — we're going to win. https://t.co/ZTGEe02j4c

You do not need a crystal ball to know our future if we continue our inaction on climate change.
Our future will include more floods.
More wildfires.
More heatwaves.
More extreme weather occurrences.
And for what? The short-term profits of the fossil fuel industry. ENOUGH.
It is absolutely imperative that we end the obscenity of some of the wealthiest people in this country and the largest corporations, in a given year, not paying a nickel in federal income taxes.

We had over 2300 people join us Friday night in Indiana to discuss how our Budget Reconciliation Legislation will create millions of good-paying jobs and address issues in this country that have been ignored for far too long. Watch the discussion now: https://t.co/n7FUwRh3YJ
The immense devastation caused in Louisiana and in Mississippi by Hurricane Ida will become our new normal unless we get our act together and take bold action to combat climate change NOW.

Thank you to the over 700 people who joined us in Cedar Rapids to discuss the need to boldly address the many crises facing working families today. If we stand together, we can not only solve the issues we face, but we can also move this country forward in the fight for justice. https://t.co/ipTITRrxcv

NOW is the time for Congress to have the courage to stand up to the powerful big money special interests that have such enormous power over the economic and political life of our country. Join our town hall LIVE in Iowa. https://t.co/Mn6sDbsd3B

I am traveling to Cedar Rapids today to speak with voters about the most significant piece of legislation to benefit working families since the New Deal and the Great Depression. I hope you can join us today for this crucial discussion.

RSVP: https://t.co/ns0FtziWzs https://t.co/rQyO9flIWH

"This was the first time I had any type of government invest into me." 

After receiving the pandemic unemployment assistance as part of the American Rescue Plan, Cody and his kids were able to live with dignity. Yes, our government can and must work for all. https://t.co/8mK8yNkbQI

Sadly, I know there are many Republicans in Congress who believe that climate change isn't real, and believe that we shouldn't do anything to address it. 

Let me be clear: doing nothing on climate change is not an option. We must lead the way in the fight against climate change.

Our Budget Reconciliation Bill likely won't get ONE GOP vote — the same Republicans who voted for massive tax breaks for billionaires & voted to throw over 30 million people off the health care they have, will not provide any help to improve life for working families. Pathetic.

If we disagree on the issues, that's fine — get up, make your case, win the votes! But do not be cowardly and try to prevent people from voting just because they're going to vote against you. YES — we must pass the For The People Act and make it easier to vote in this country.

I’m LIVE in Detroit with @RashidaTlaib, @DebDingell and @Andy_Levin talking about why now is the time to invest in the working class of this country. 

WATCH: https://t.co/KLpWxMU3CC

Go into your communities, find out what the problems are, and organize. The rich continue to get richer while so many working families are struggling.

We must educate, organize, and get people to stand up for their rights. https://t.co/bynM7ncSsT

"Investing in human infrastructure is one of our most valuable assets to aid Hoosiers and other Americans rebuild after the pandemic. We have to stop thinking about the world we once had, and start thinking about the world we're leaving our kids." - Mary, a single mom in Indiana https://t.co/0sU3pPwO2o

"It's clear that as inequality grows, climate change will only deepen the injustices that we already face. We must solve the environmental crisis and the crisis of inequality at the same time." - Adrian, a student at Purdue University https://t.co/YxTqVm00Jo

"After receiving support from the American Rescue Plan, I felt a sense of hope, and it echoed through my children and the people around me. Our government finally invested in me." - Cody, a dad living in Indiana https://t.co/ozsUL8JZgS

Under reconciliation, we will lead the world in transforming our energy system away from fossil fuels, make our homes and buildings more energy efficient, make agriculture greener, and we will establish a Civilian Climate Corps, providing good wages and benefits for young people. https://t.co/6cYAoIhWxx

In our country today, we pay far more per capita for prescription drugs than any other major country on Earth. What our Budget Reconciliation Legislation does is tell the pharmaceutical industry: yeah, we're going to end your greed. https://t.co/AmMr9P5321

Thank you to the more than 2,300 people who joined me tonight in Indiana to talk about the desperate need to invest in the working people of this country. If we stand together, we can build a new future based on justice. https://t.co/uU934IeNLe
I'm LIVE in Indiana to talk about how we are finally going to address the long-neglected needs of working families, the elderly, the sick and the most vulnerable among us. https://t.co/Y0NfOmbEJ4

Today, I am hitting the road to speak directly with the people of Indiana about the need of our government to finally invest in the long-neglected needs of the working class. I very much look forward to speaking with them.

Join us today: https://t.co/KvGqdYa9f1 https://t.co/vtlU34m85u

I've said it before and I'll say it again: It is time for the Congress to finally have the guts to stand up to the wealthy and special interests, and restore the people's faith in the idea that our government can work for all of us. https://t.co/oeTApAOrfJ

Join our town hall in West Lafayette, Indiana tomorrow, August 27: https://t.co/v6pojFr29E

Join our town hall in Cedar Rapids, Iowa on Sunday, August 29: https://t.co/hTnak3Pwge

I understand that budget chairpersons, historically, have done their work within the Beltway in D.C. 

I think really, the function of a budget chairman is to get out among the people. 

I very much look forward to speaking to working families in Indiana and Iowa this weekend.

Congress just took a HUGE step toward enacting the most consequential legislation for working people since the New Deal. A lot of work is left, but we are on track to meet the long-neglected needs of the working class and combat the threat of climate change. Let’s get it done.
We must end the absurdity that sees dozens of major corporations not paying a nickel in federal income taxes.

We're going to tax the wealth of these billionaires, and with the Budget Reconciliation Legislation, we are finally going to invest in the needs of the working class of this country. 

Trust me, I wrote the damn bill. https://t.co/tDRH2XGRhL

We must restore the faith of the American people in their government. 
That we see their pain and we respond to that pain. 
That we have the courage to take on powerful special interests. 

This is a pivotal moment in American history. We must meet this moment with bold action.

In a compassionate, democratic society we can have a government that works for all of us, and not just the wealthy few and powerful campaign contributors.

That's what I believe. We are in this together. Let us go forward and get this done.

Tell me, why is the GOP, the so-called "party of the working class," so comfortable in voting for tax breaks for the ultra-rich, but when it comes to legislation which addresses the long-neglected needs of the poor and working class of this country, they are nowhere to be found?

After 20 years of war, 2,448 American lives lost and over $1T spent, President Biden made the courageous decision to reject Washington’s failed interventionist consensus and end the Afghanistan war. Now we must do everything we can to support evacuations and welcome refugees.

The Rev. Jesse Jackson has been one of the great leaders of our time in the fight for racial, social and economic justice.  He and his wife, Jacqueline, have been hospitalized with COVID-19.  Jane and I and all Americans wish them a full and speedy recovery.

Other major countries guarantee, on average, 20 weeks of paid time off for new moms.

In the U.S., new moms are guaranteed Z-E-R-O days of paid leave to spend with their baby.

With our Budget Reconciliation Legislation, we are going to end that international embarrassment.

The top 1% of Americans currently hold 15x MORE wealth than the bottom 50% combined. The reality is that the economy is working very well for the super-rich, without meeting the needs of ordinary Americans. 

We must turn that around. Our economy can and must work for all of us.

When you're a billionaire and the pandemic has treated you pretty well, making you billions of dollars richer, I suppose "I'm going to float around in outer space," sounds like a great idea.

I happen to think making billionaires finally pay their fair share is a better idea.

I hope you'll join me as I host town halls in Indiana and in Iowa to speak directly with working class voters about the need of our government to invest in the people. 

Join us in Indiana: https://t.co/q1HbTIu2Q5

Join us in Iowa: https://t.co/FvF1t84cPl https://t.co/NMTBBfzpLl

While it will have no Republican support in Washington, Democrats, Independents and working class Republicans all over the country support our plan to finally invest in the long-neglected needs of working families. I very much look forward to hearing from some of them next week.

Within the next several months Congress will be voting on the most consequential piece of legislation for working people, the elderly, the children, the sick and the poor since Franklin Delano Roosevelt and the New Deal of the 1930s.

A rigged economy looks like CEO pay going up by 52.6% since 2009 while nearly half of all American workers cannot afford to rent a 1-bedroom apartment anywhere in this country. 

It's time for our economy to work for all of us, not just the wealthy few. https://t.co/1DlOnSTXzm

I stand in solidarity with @BCTGM workers in Oregon, Colorado, and Virginia who are on strike for a fair contract and for decent working conditions. If Nabisco can rake in billions of dollars in corporate profits, they can afford to treat their workers with dignity and respect.

With our budget reconciliation legislation, we will make the largest investment in America's working families in decades. It means finally guaranteeing paid family & medical leave. It means free, universal pre-K. It means finally making child care affordable. Let's get it done.

A government which responds to the needs of its people and not just the interests of corporations is what we must demand in this moment if we are to restore the American people's faith in our democracy.

Direct payments as a result of the expanded Child Tax Credit are now in month two. In that time:
- child poverty has been cut in HALF
- we have seen a significant decrease in child hunger

Our job now: extend the expanded Child Tax Credit. Let's get it done.

July was the hottest month in recorded history. I will say that again — we just experienced the hottest month EVER in the history of the planet. 

I do not want future generations to look back on this moment and ask why we did not do all we could to address climate change.

Since the start of the pandemic, billionaires in this country have gotten some $1.8 trillion richer, while half our people live paycheck to paycheck. 

Please do not tell me that the billionaires of this country cannot afford to finally pay their fair share of taxes. https://t.co/F9v7M4w5p0

I find it interesting that for my Republican colleagues, when it comes to tax breaks for the rich and corporations — that's okay. But when you demand that we invest in the working families of this country, well, suddenly the sky is falling!

I am a little tired of that hypocrisy.

CEO pay between 1978-2020: Up 1,322%
Worker pay between 1978-2020: FLAT

That's the kind of greed and inequality we have got to end.

After Trump's so-called "big, beautiful" tax cut, 82 ultra-wealthy households saved more than $1 BILLION on their tax bills. Absurd.

It's time we make sure our economy works for the working people of this country, not just a handful of people at the top. https://t.co/L3pvZk3yPD

California is burning. Oregon is burning. Greece is burning. There is historic drought hitting virtually every country on the planet.

NEWSFLASH! Climate change is real! And yeah, the United States has got to get its act together and lead on addressing the climate crisis.

In the face of so much devastation being wrought by decades of inaction, we cannot sit by and do nothing. When the Civilian Climate Corps is created, we will mobilize young people who care so deeply about the future of this planet to combat climate change. https://t.co/4tDzhIKGsp

Some of my Republican colleagues still refuse to accept that climate change is real. I refuse to accept that this is the planet we are going to leave our kids and our grandkids. We must take bold action NOW to combat climate change, and that’s exactly what we are going to do. https://t.co/JGlSWQ0WIH

The most important investment we can make is in the children of this country. That is exactly why we are going to make free pre-K for all working families a reality. That is exactly why we are going to finally join every other major country and guarantee paid family leave.
Let us end the days of 2 people in this country owning more wealth than the bottom 40% of our people combined.

I've heard a lot from the punditry as to why Nina Turner lost her race in Ohio. Well, maybe it had something to do with drug companies, Wall Street and the fossil fuel industry spending millions trying to defeat her. Is that the kind of Democratic Party we want? I don't think so.

Shock of shocks! A health care system which prioritizes the profits of health insurance companies and pharmaceutical manufacturers over the health of its people is ranked dead last among other major countries!

We need Medicare for All. https://t.co/Y5svUPjYTL

Today marks 56 years since the passage of the Voting Rights Act. And today, there are nearly 400 bills in legislatures in nearly all 50 states aimed at suppressing the right to vote. We must make it easier, not harder to vote in this country. We must pass the For the People Act.

In America today, working class people pay, on average, a tax rate that is 24x higher than that of Jeff Bezos, one of the richest guys on the entire planet. 

Maybe, just maybe it's time for the billionaire class to pay their fair share of taxes.
I want you to imagine an America in which every working family is guaranteed free pre-K education for their kids. https://t.co/LneBLgqhln

Women should not have to go back to work days after giving birth. We must end the international embarrassment of being the only major country on Earth not to guarantee paid leave for workers. 

With our budget reconciliation legislation, that's exactly what we're going to do.
81% of Democrats, 66% of Independents, and 57% of Republicans all agree with what you and I know to be true — it's time to tax the ultra-rich in this country.
We are living in an unprecedented moment. Now is the time for unprecedented action.

Let me tell you. People are sick and tired of seeing day after day, the rich getting richer while everyone else struggles just to keep their heads above water. People want action. And that's exactly what we're going to give them with this budget reconciliation legislation.

For decades, Congress has paid a whole lot of attention to the rich and the powerful and to campaign contributors while ignoring the needs of the working class of this country. 

Those days are over.

Here's how our economic system works today. The rich get richer while half our people live paycheck to paycheck. Outrageous! 

Yeah, we are going to raise taxes on the wealthiest people in this country. And yeah, we are finally going to make sure our economy works for all of us.

I know @ninaturner. I've known her for years. She is, without a doubt, one of the strongest fighters for justice that I have ever met in my life. We need her in Congress. 

Polls are open now until 7:30 pm — Ohio, get out and VOTE! https://t.co/stDxAKsGIB
I am once again asking you to get vaccinated.
The people need @ninaturner in Congress. I urge the voters of Ohio's 11th District to elect her this Tuesday, August 3rd. https://t.co/06WwUBrF0V

A rigged economy is billionaires not paying a nickel in income tax while we've got half our people living paycheck to paycheck and hundreds of thousands sleeping out on the streets. 

We are going to end that absurdity and finally make the wealthy pay their fair share of taxes.
"Our people-centered agenda has some people very afraid. Why are big-money special interest groups spending all of this money? They like the way things are now." - @ninaturner https://t.co/fUQt5baD9h
"I will wake up every day fighting to create Medicare for All so that health care is finally a right and not privilege in the United States of America." - @ninaturner https://t.co/GDw3nsg5Sp
"Addressing the material conditions and lifting people so that they don't just fall behind, but so that they can get ahead — that's what this campaign is about." - @ninaturner https://t.co/1sVtoImVwE

If you want somebody who's not going to be just another member of Congress, but someone who has the guts to speak out on the important issues, and fight for working people, I urge you to elect @ninaturner to represent Ohio's 11th District. https://t.co/zYOgO2Sqmi

Why are the drug companies, the insurance companies, the fossil fuel industry, Wall Street, and people who supported Donald Trump spending millions of dollars to try to defeat @ninaturner? They know that when she is elected that she will take them on in the fight for justice. https://t.co/GgiT4RXU8q

.@ninaturner will stand with me in saying that today, we have got to expand Medicare to cover hearing aids, dental care, and eyeglasses. And Nina knows we have got to go further and guarantee health care to all through a Medicare for All, single-payer program. https://t.co/Iwfun3E01C
